message.entry: The images being loaded are large and they may not fit into memory. To avoid running out of memory during your app session import as Blocked Images.
Should never reach here as AddFromDatastore should be disabled
Load only the data being looked at, with an overview of the entire image.
Attempt to load images into the memory.
For more information Image Labeler for Blocked Images.
Loading groundTruth objects with Pixel labels is not supported when labeling Blocked Images

The images being loaded are large and they may not fit into memory. To avoid running out of memory during your app session and losing labels, consider starting a new app session and loading the images as Blocked Images.

Choose "Yes" to attempt to load these images into memory. This may cause MATLAB to freeze.

Choose "No" to return to the app without loading these images.

The images being loaded are large and they likely will not fit into memory. To avoid running out of memory during your app session, consider loading the images as Blocked Images.

Choose "Yes" to attempt to load these images into memory. This may cause MATLAB to freeze.

Choose "No" to return to the app without loading these images.
Do not show again in this session
This DICOM file does not contain image data.
Your data contains multiframe DICOM images. Select a base folder for the app to store the images as individual image files that are required for further processing.
Labeling Blocked Images does not support Pixel Labels. Drop Pixel Label definitions and proceed?
Import as Blocked Image will delete pixel label definitions.
The interactive icon can be used to hide and unhide labels within the image browser upon clicking.
Add 2-D images of any size or with multiple resolutions

The current session contains an image datastore with the custom read function: ''{0}''. Only image datastores with the same custom read function can be added. To load other image sources, create a new session.
When the current session contains images, image datastores with custom read functions can not be added. Create a new session to load this datastore.
The file name ''{0}'' contains an invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x13). Rename the file to import it into the app.
The selected session was saved using the Training Image Labeler app and will be updated for use in the Image Labeler app. Please save the current Image Labeler session.
The following errors occurred while reading image data:\n\n{0}
'Project file invalid:\n' '%s.\n .prj file and containing folder must have same name'.
Only scalar groundTruth objects whose data source is a collection of images or an image datastore is supported.
Only scalar groundTruth objects whose definitions do not contain a Custom or Line label type is supported.
Load a collection of images, label definitions, or session.
Export ground truth labels to a file or workspace.
Add rectangle or pixel label ROIs to the image.
Add scene label to selected images.
Remove scene label from selected images.
Define new rectangle or pixel label ROI.
The selected images and all their associated annotations will be removed. Are you sure you want to remove these images?
All images and all their associated annotations will be removed. This will remove all the tasks too. Are you sure you want to remove these images?
The selected images will be rotated and saved to disk. Do you still want to continue?\n\nNote: If you selected any DICOM images, they will not be rotated.
Unable to save rotated images. Please check if you have write permission to resave the images.
Unable to rotate and write all the images to the disk. Please check if you have permission to write to the file.
{0} does not exist as a valid MAT file name or a folder!
No images have been added.\n {0} does not contain any valid images.
Choose between groundTruth or table export format. groundTruth must be used if there are any scene or pixel labels or if the session contains a datastore with a custom read function.
Opening the new Image Labeler app in place of the Training Image Labeler. Use imageLabeler instead of trainingImageLabeler.
Choose how to display labels on images.
The {0} is not a blockedImage automation algorithm
Multiple Images blockedImage Automation is only enabled for images with same number of resolution levels

To label multiple images automatically, specify the region to process, resolution level, and block size. If you have Parallel Computing Toolbox, click Use Parallel to take advantage of parallel processing techniques. To access parameters specific to the algorithm, click Settings. Click Run to label the images. To specify custom-drawn regions, click Draw Region. Use the cursor to draw ROIs on the image. Your algorithm processes only the areas specified in the ROIs. The regions processed may not exactly match the dimensions of the ROIs. When an ROI partially covers a block, the labeler processes the entire block.
This button performs automation on the current region displayed
This button performs automation on the whole image region
This button puts user in drawing mode to draw one or more polygons to provide as regions to perform automation in
Select a Resolution Level to automate at
Define number of rows to be used in blockSize
Define number of columns to be used in blockSize
It uses PCT and parallel pool of workers
Selected region did not include any blocks to be processed. Consider modifying InclusionThreshold property
Incorrect output format of blockedImage automation algorithm. The structure must contain fields Type, Name and Position
Choose Task to display images associated with it.
All images in the current project
Images that can be assigned to a label task
Images that can be assigned to a review task
The status of image cannot change after task assignment.
The selected images are assigned to the published task, please unpublish the tasks before deleting images.
Temporary pixel label data folder is inaccessible or corrupted.
Assign task to the project owner.
Add instructions for the task owner.

Set the number of images to select from the Image Browser to add to a selected task. Only images that can be added to the specified task are included. For example, images that are ready to be reviewed, can only be selected to add to a review task.
Add selected images to the Images List of the selected Task.
To add images to the selected task, you must first select them from the Image Browser or increase the number of images to select in the spinner.
One or more images selected in the Image Browser cannot be assigned to the selected task. Select only those images that can be assigned to the selected task.
Remove selected images from the Images List.
To remove images from the selected task, you must first select them from the Images List.
No feedback available for the current image.
Add feedback for the current image.
No instructions were provided for this task.
All images are marked labeled or shared for review and cannot be used with automated labeling.
Images that are marked labeled or are shared for review are locked and cannot be used with automated labeling. Click Continue to automate labeling with unlocked images.
Shows line upon the visual summary plot based on added labels when checked
Show the visual summary for the images currently displayed in the Image Browser. Uncheck to view the distribution for all images.
Number of Label Tasks must be less than or equal to a value that is a minimum of either the number of unassigned images or 25.
Total number of images to distribute
Number of unassigned and unlabeled images to be distributed.
Number of distributed images assigned to each Label Task.
Navigate to next scene label frame
Navigate to previous scene label frame
